column4: hello. An SD card mounts ok on my mini with SD port. However, on my desktop, where i have one of those multiformat USB card readers, the SD card mounts as read only. How can i get it to mount as read/write?
you sure the mechanical switch on the sd-cardis set to writable?
is it also ubuntu on the otherpc?samefilesystem?
mini-8.04 desktop:8.10
just read some similar problem,have you tried to copy something on it with sudo?
yes. i've tried chmoding it- it wont let me
in the text i readit randomly was mountedroor rw, then it was plugged in as another user and it worked
- i tried mkfs'ing it. it didnt work (cannot format a mounted drive, cannot find the device if its not mounted)
what d'you mean mounted roor rw?
in the example the user was able to write to the card with sudo nautilus
oh i see. i wasnt able to do that
and he tried it with another normal user account and then the sd-card worked again, odd
did you try to connect the reader to the mini? if it doesn't work there either, it could be a driver bug, or sth like that, has it ever worked read/writable before with ubuntu?
I don't have one of those,I'm using a camera in SD-Card Reader modesometimes,maybe this would be a workaround until you find a way to fix your problem
in = as
the two computers aren't on a LAN I suggest?
and the reader has worked before with ubuntu or was it always like that?
what I mean is, did you manage to use the reader with ubuntu before as intended?
nope. never could use it as intended on the machine its on. the read-only SD card wont even let me Gparted it
hm, ok,as I don't know how to fix this, my advice would be to replace the reader, if possible :)
or maybe you can test a live cd with it
or even consider an upgrade to 9.10
there's a chance it could be working with a newer release
